page.title: 14Cults Limeworks
page.content: Cults Hill overlooks Pitlessie and is well known for its{lime}.The remains of a few disused{limestone mines}still remain.{Lime kilns}can be found in the woods.When they were in use there were layers of stone and coal at the bottom of a kiln and men would shovel the lime in to burn it.They had to wear masks around their mouths because the hot lime used to burn their skins. Only one limestone mine remains today and the lime dug from it is used for {liming fields. The{brickworks}lies below the present day limeworks.It was opened at the end of 1962.Local lime,however is not used to make these bricks because it is not of suitable quality.
